bradleyross.j2ee.servlets

Class Servlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • bradleyross.j2ee.servlets.Servlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DownloadItem, EchoBack

    public abstract class Servlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Superclass for servlets.
    Author:
    Bradley Ross
    See Also:
    ServletHelpers, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Servlet.ThisPage
      This class is placed here so that the programmer can subclass either Servlet.ThisPage or bradleyross.library.servlets.ThisPage.

      • starter

        public void starter(Servlet.ThisPage thisPage)
             throws IOException
        Processing before calling processor method.

        This method can be overridden in subclasses to provide a class that carries out the desired operation for a group of classes.

        Parameters:
        thisPage - Information on this HTTP transaction
        Throws:
        IOException - for io problems

      • buildEscapeDate

        public static String buildEscapeDate(int year,
                                     int month,
                                     int day)
                              throws IOException
        Build a date in the java.sql.Date escape format.
        Parameters:
        year - Year as an integer
        month - Month as an integer from 1 to 12
        day - Day of month as an integer from 1 to 31
        Returns:
        Date in escape format
        Throws:
        IOException - for io problems
        See Also:

        It appears that SQL Server is unable to handle dates before the year 1900.

      • buildEscapeDate

        public static String buildEscapeDate(String year,
                                     String month,
                                     String day)
                              throws IOException
        Build a date in the java.sql.Date escape format.
        Parameters:
        year - String containing the year as an integer
        month - String containing the month as an integer from 1 to 12
        day - String containing the day of month as an integer from 1 to 31
        Returns:
        Date in escape format
        Throws:
        IOException - for io problems
        See Also:
        Date.toString()

      • buildEscapeDate

        public static String buildEscapeDate(int year,
                                     int month,
                                     int day,
                                     String defaultDate)
                              throws IOException
        Build a date in the java.sql.Date escape format.
        Parameters:
        year - Year as an integer
        month - Month as an integer from 1 to 12
        day - Day of month as an integer from 1 to 31
        defaultDate - Date to use if error in processing
        Returns:
        Date in escape format
        Throws:
        IOException - for io problems
        See Also:

        It appears that SQL Server is unable to handle dates before the year 1900.

      • buildEscapeDate

        public static String buildEscapeDate(String year,
                                     String month,

                                     String defaultDate)

        Parameters:
        year - String containing the year as an integer
        month - String containing the month as an integer from 1 to 12
        day - String containing the day of month as an integer from 1 to 31
        defaultDate - Date to use if error in processing
        Returns:
        Date in escape format
        Throws:
        IOException - for io problems
        See Also:
        Date.toString()

        Returns:

      • loadChar

                        int location,
                        String value)
                 throws SQLException
        Utility method for setting parameters in Prepared Statements.

        For CHAR data types.

        Parameters:
        stmt - PreparedStatement object
        location - Number of parameter
        value - Value to be loaded in parameter
        Throws:
        SQLException - if problems in SQL statement

      • matchValues

        public static String matchValues(String value1,
                                 String value2)
        Utility to aid in creating option lists for pull-down menus.
        Parameters:
        value1 - First string to be compared
        value2 - Second string to be compared
        Returns:
        The word SELECTED if the two strings match, otherwise a blank.

      • getTextValue

        public static String getTextValue(ResultSet rs,
                                  String name)
        Obtains a value from a result set for use as the value attribute of a input element of type text.
        Parameters:
        rs - Result set
        name - Name of column in result set
        Returns:
        Text string for value attribute.

      • getTextareaValue

        public static String getTextareaValue(ResultSet rs,
                                      String name)
        Obtains a value from a result set for use as the starting value of a Textarea element.
        Parameters:
        rs - Result set
        name - Name of column in result set
        Returns:
        Text string for Textarea tag.
        See Also:
        StringHelpers.escapeHTML(String, String)

      • getString

        public static String getString(ResultSet rs,
                               String name)
        Returns the string for a non-breaking space if a string column in a table is null or blank, otherwise returns an escaped string.
        Parameters:
        rs - Result set containing value
        name - Name of column
        Returns:
        Processed string for insertion in web page
